Unnamed Package

  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    Address
    Contains address info for a contact.
    Contact
    Contains the contact/client information.
    ContactFactory
    This is a read only file that generates a bunch of contacts.
    ContactsController
    Class that handles the program flow when dealing with listing contacts and the contact listing for a single contact READ ONLY
    ContactsView
    Handles viewing contacts both single and as a group.
    Email
    Basic holder for an email.
    English
    This is one way to setup localization strings based on the locality of the client using the application.
    English.Contacts
     
    English.Login
     
    English.Main
     
    English.Message
     
    LoginController
    Handles the logic of clients logging into the message system by checking if they are valid users, and checking passwords
    LoginView
    Basic view and interaction associated with the sign-in/login screen
    Main
    Practical 2: Encrypted Communications For this practical, the students will work with an encrypted contact application that is meant to send messages between contacts.
    MainController
    Controls the main menu program flow.
    MainView
    Main View handles interaction with the client - essentially System.in and System.out
    Message
    Holds a message for the client, so they can read it.
    MessageController
     
    MessageView
    Handles the input and output for the Messages Section of the application
    PhoneNumber
    Basic object to hold phone numbers.
    SecurityHash
    Basic methods to help secure passwords in the system.
    ShiftingCaesarCipher
    While the traditional Caesar Cipher 'shifts' a letter down the alphabet, and by knowing the correct shift, you an shift it back the correct direction, a Security.ShiftingCaesarCipher changes the shift amount every so many number of characters.
    SubstitutionCipher
    A simple Security.SubstitutionCipher takes a message, and substitutes each letter in for another letter in the alphabet.
    UnitTest
    UnitTesting is essential *after* you work through a method, and have it running.
